Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a course offered by CyberLearn.

description.description: A description of the course content and objectives.

instructorId.description: Reference to the Instructor who teaches the course. (Relationship: Instructor 1:N Course)

learningObjectives.description: A list of learning objectives for the course.

curriculum.description: A list of curriculum topics covered in this course.

category.description: The category the course belongs to.

bio.description: A short biography of the instructor.

email.description: The email address of the instructor.

Student.title: Student
Student.description: Represents a student's profile at CyberLearn.

id.description: Unique identifier for the student (matches Firebase Auth UID).

name.description: The full name of the student.

email.description: The primary email address of the student.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

onboardingStatus.description: Tracks the user's progress through the initial setup flow.

enrolledCourseIds.description: References to Courses the student is enrolled in. (Relationship: Student N:N Course)

Enrollment.title: Enrollment
Enrollment.description: Represents a student's enrollment in a course and their purchase.

id.description: Unique identifier for the enrollment record.

studentId.description: Reference to the Student who is enrolled. (Relationship: Student 1:N Enrollment)

courseId.description: Reference to the Course the student is enrolled in. (Relationship: Course 1:N Enrollment)

enrollmentDate.description: The date the student enrolled in the course.

purchaseDate.description: The date the course was purchased

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to provide a secure and scalable data model for the CyberLearn application, focusing on authorization independence and clear data relationships. The structure emphasizes path-based ownership for private user data and membership maps for collaborative data access. 

Authorization Independence (CRITICAL):  Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding the get() function in rules. This is accomplished via denormalization: relevant authorization data (such as course instructor) is included directly within the documents where it's needed.

QAPs Support: List operations are secured through structural segregation and path-based ownership. User-specific data (enrollments) is stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, allowing secure listing of only the current user's enrollments. Access to the courses collection is controlled by role-based access via the instructorId field, and is publicly readable only.
